subject: Entrepreneurship
title: MVP Anti-Patterns
description: A quick, practical guide to MVP Anti-Patterns.

hook.text: Most MVPs failâ€”not because the idea is bad, but because founders make the same three mistakes.

buildup.text: Mistake one: building too much. If your MVP takes six months, it's not minimum.

discovery.text: Mistake two: measuring the wrong thing. Downloads don't matter if nobody comes back the next day.

twist.text: Mistake three: ignoring the results. Founders see bad data and convince themselves it'll improve.

climax.text: The best MVPs are embarrassingly simpleâ€”so simple that founders feel uncomfortable sharing them.

punchline.text: If you're not embarrassed by your MVP, you launched too late.

quiz.question: Which of these is a common MVP anti-pattern?
options: Launching too quickly with too few features
Building too much before getting customer feedback
Choosing a small initial target market
